text: people are just so absorbed in their
technology and always looking down
they're forgetting to look up and when
you look up that is when the magic
happens when you can tap into the
present moment there is no other feeling
like it
we're constantly being updated from our
friends or family and we're constantly
feeling like we need to always update
what we're doing where we are and that's
just what it's like in this day and age
with social media on top of that there's
so many different platforms that you
feel it you need to be part of or you're
missing out so there's so many different
platforms that you need to update
constantly update telling people exactly
what you're doing and your mind is
swamped with all of these updates from
everybody and also feeling the need to
always feel like you have to be doing
something you have to be getting better
at something you have to be more
successful you have to have more
followers you have to constantly have
this exciting life that is a lot to
handle there's a lot of pressure that
does a lot to think of I'm at an age
where I remember a time before the
internet when I would wake up in the
morning I would go outside and I would
play all day I would not come home until
I was dirty and the Sun had gone down
and I realized maybe I should probably
eat something today because I was having
so much fun I'd actually forget to eat
there was no sitting in front of a TV
set playing video games all day or
console a on the computer I can't
imagine being in the generation where
that is all you know you just know the
internet and social media and you don't
remember a life before that this morning
when I was driving when I was taking a
drive I saw a couple of people along the
beach and they had their phones out and
they were recording taking pictures of
the beach and then they would just like
leave and walk away I didn't see them
actually stand there and use their eyes
and look at this beautiful beach the
beautiful waves feel the breeze and feel
the Sun on their skin and just like
really soak in that present moment
instead they got in their car they took
a picture of the beach they got back in
their car and then left and then they're
gonna post that probably just social
media say oh I was in Malibu I went to
the beach it was beautiful but were you
actually there it makes me sad to see
someone always connect it to their
device and not aware of what's going
around them and not being present with
the moment that they are currently in
they're constantly looking at what has
happened in the past with their friends
and updating people what they did and
what they're about to do and not just
like being present with people having
real conversations face-to-face with
someone and it makes me sad to see that
people are just so absorbed in their
technology and always looking down
they're forgetting to look up and when
you look up that is when the magic
happens
to be completely absorbed in the current
life experience to be completely present
in what's going on in the exact moment
that you're in not thinking about the
past not thinking about the future just
be just being it is such an incredible
feeling there's nothing else like it
for me it's pure happiness it's pure joy
it's when I feel like my true self like
all the doubts and worries and thoughts
concerns all of a sudden just they're
gone I'm not thinking about them and I
can just be my true self it's funny for
me and I'd love to know if this happens
to you as well that you actually have to
I have to practice being present I have
to like actually remember to be present
and the more I do this the longer I can
stay in that present moment and the more
often it happens there are practices
that I do that helped me to get into
that present moment faster and is daily
meditation if I do a daily meditation
for even just like 10 minutes every
morning or yoga if I do yoga every
morning if I'm doing that for about a
week straight I am able to tap into that
present moment so often throughout the
day for longer for longer periods of
time and that's why I think yoga and
meditation is so special because it
helps you get there and when you get
there life becomes more full more rich
because you were really truly
experiencing it another way to get
the present moment is to really just
concentrate on one thing and really try
to just focus on it and activate all of
my senses smell it touch it taste it
hear it see it and if my mind trails off
to something else and I start thinking
of what I have to do or something else
I allow myself to be like to be okay and
not to get frustrated because that is
the monkey brain among monkey mind doing
what it usually does it's very common we
all do it all of our minds do it but to
just one once I become aware that that's
what's happening I just bring it back to
that same object and try to tune in
again to really experience that one
thing in that moment and it comes to
traveling it is especially important to
look up get off those devices look up
and really soak in the experiences that
you're having so I urge you today and
every day to really practice be present
practice on being in the moment you
currently are and appreciating
everything that's happening right now be
grateful for how your body feels for
what you're experiencing and really soak
in the present moment because really the
present moment is all we have the past
is gone future is the future right now
is what you have so it's important to
really live in it I hope you guys like
this video just sitting down and
chatting with you guys didn't plan it I
just turn on the camera and told you how
I feel and I think this is a really
important topic to talk about if you
like this type of video just sitting
down chatting and you guys telling me
